task.summary: Default task
Added rudimentary system for selecting Combatants.
Refined Combatant selection with talk commands.
Removed casting Events to subclasses.
Added additional enemies.
Refactored Flag classes to eliminate switch statement in checkForTrigger().
Refactored access levels in Event package.
Refactored Event class so that withX() method functionality is moved into the InstructionData class.
Removed second generic in Event, SimpleEvent, and CompoundEvent.
Fixed "voice" keybind so that view recenters on player, and second enter is not needed to end dialogue trees.
Fixed "go_to_previous" and "go_to_default" keybinds so that view recenters on player.
Added ItemPromptLoader class to item package.
Items interacted with through the "use" keybind now add their assigned prompts (if any) onto the prompt queue on use.
Added rough Skill class implementation.
Added rough Skill implementation and integration into the View/Controller.
Put Item loading functionality into its own utility class.
Implemented proper "use skill" command. Executing compound event "USE_SKILL" now adds events to the event queue.

Reorganized Event Hierarchy - Eliminated the need for Compound Opcodes by subclassing the decompose method, and moved the Opcode attribute from Event to SimpleEvent. By doing these things, generics is no longer needed in Event, as was removed.
Roughly moved game session initialization data out of the main method into the GameSession constructor (formerly "Display").
Added very rudimentary Main Menu screen, as well as a default main menu state.
Added basic MVC to main menu screen.

A few changes: - Rough implementation of a separate JPanel containing an options pane. - Keybinds in panels placed in the JFrame after the initial one now function properly. - Neatened DisplayKeyBinds so that no keybinds are bound to the JPanel's parent.
Removed irrelevant mainmenu classes, as well as removed controllers, opting to merge the view with the contents of the controller to eliminate poltergeisting.
Added options to change display resolution, as well as toggle windowed/fullscreen display modes.
Added a few graphic constants to MainMenuDisplay.
Added basic sound effects when user moves between main menu options.
Revised music list to show OptionSelect sfx (Whoops).
Created proper AudioPlayer class that stores audio as maps.
Adjusted music looping in AudioPlayer by setting cycle counts instead of on song end events.
Added mouse controls to main menu.
Added in-game pause menu implementation, made "start" option in main menu open a JLayeredPane instead of the GameSession JPanel.
Pause Menu is now implemented correctly via Observer.
Reorganized file locations in display package.
Simplified WindowController constructor by moving initialization details of JPanels to representative constructors.
Added new GameView, and working (but messy) grid display.
Revised Footer class structure (though none work, at the moment).
Separated Footer displays into individual classes.
Removed unnecessary and outmoded footer classes.
Revised game sidebar classes to conform to new game display.
Merged GameSession and GameView.
Enemies can now be initialized with items, and drop items on death.
Enemies can now initialize with skills. Skill sets can now be represented as strings.
Added save implementation.
Added load implementation (Though combatant class will now need serious refactoring).
Removed outmoded generics in grid classes.
CatalogMap can no longer receive multiple values per key. Instruction TRANSFER_ITEMALL now picks up all items on a single tile.
Refactored Skill class: Added comments, as well as proper equals/hash functions to Skill, so that SkillSet can now be a proper set.

Refactored Event and InstructionData: Now consists of a grouping of objects instead of their respective IDs. Naturally, this made quite a stir in other parts of the program, and will be fixed in immediate, later version(s).
Refactored all relevant classes to work with the new InstructionData setup. No more compilation errors exist due to this refactor as of this commit.
Fixed issues with the UseItem, UseSkill, and DropItem compound events, where the caster/targets were not properly specified upon entry into the event queue.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: Fixed issues with the UseItem, UseSkill, and DropItem compound events, where the caster/targets were not properly specified upon entry into the event queue.
